title: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Pasco County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Pasco County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Welcome to the Pasco Sheriff's Office Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau, 
 
Thank you for registering with Pasco Sheriff's Office Public Records. 
 
Your Login ID is:  149248-91126572@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HSKPglSNFMEM-2FWg5SowrdqagI3oKA2bGXI3OrLOhvG184wDHIBMXtsCuygJUDlTKp8RV74QVhMm5b4XNdqxfg7g-3D5DPi_l1SDzdeMsyUtIQfJBGPT1o2l1Hhe1G-2FSEk-2FzcN-2B28aIpSQLD1I892Cim2riYbVdudX7Hr-2FEM6ipwEOyU8A3VKHLEcYgaMzZTB9hZAaaWCPT8iyepuaZ9EG-2BqzDEn17jl80-2BZC-2FKAhjGV0ygNSMag5-2FIGclQD0OoJfDcUXRwKmHfPGB0AKslQ62UUWRjtbYfDyR-2Byf8jtvQ-2BXM6ve-2FFwoiC8NFxXzhfKRPqyziiyXTBw-3D) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R012823-071723
communications.communication:
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 17, 2023., Reference # R012823-071723. 
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau, 
The Pasco Sheriff's Office is in receipt of your public information request dated July 17, 2023 for the below records: "To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fpasco-county-sheriffs-office-5363%252Fvehicular-pursuit-policies-pasco-county-sheriffs-office-149248%252F%253Femail%253Drrequest%252540pascosheriff.org&url_auth_token=AAAPbBetaJuoq7F1AXQOCXytNy0%3A1qLFxH%3AhqKG4-K_GDSsyEhZxqiGvYlq4E5mJIOzb-V-u_wpBu0" 
In order to process your request in a timely manner, please ensure that you respond to all correspondence within 10 business days, or the request will be considered withdrawn. Pursuant to F.S. 119, fees may apply. 
Sincerely, 
Pasco County Sheriff's Office

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Covington Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Covington Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Georgia Open Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 14, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

MuckRock News

263 Huntington Ave

PLEASE NOTE: This request is not filed by a MuckRock staff member, but is being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share, and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed (i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable.

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Elizabethtown Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Elizabethtown Police Department)
communications.communication:
Please fill out our Right To know request form. Thank you! Lynn

Lynn Mohr
Elizabethtown Police Dept.
600 South Hanover Street
Elizabethtown, PA 17022
Phone: 717.367.6540 x231
Fax:     717.367.2332
This e-mail and any files transmitted with it are confidential and are intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed. This communication may contain material protected by the Criminal History Record Information Act. If you are not the intended recipient or the person responsible for delivering this e-mail to the intended recipient, be advised that you have received this e-mail in error and that any use, dissemination, forwarding, printing or copying of this e-mail is strictly prohibited. If you have received this e-mail in error, please immediately notify the Elizabethtown Police Department by replying to this message and deleting it from your computer or contact us at this telephone number (717) 367-6540.

Good Morning,
You will need to fill out a Right to Know Request form. At that time .  The information of your request will be reviewed and then approved or denied by the interim Chief.  All names will be redacted from report(s).
